Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky brown below; part of a lotus flower in faded added white outline with traces of added red; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior above two white bands (Williams 1983, 169) and many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and apart from Nauklratis, several have been found on Aegina. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1690) (phase 2)
